conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m formally applying. School_B is my first choice because I value the academic environment and I’m ready to commit fully if offered a seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. However, School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_C). Student_A and Student_C also rank School_B as their top choice, and Student_B ranks it 2nd, so competition will be intense. Still, applying now is the only way to have any chance at my first choice; if rejected, I can pivot next round to School_C where I’m ranked 3rd and may have a better chance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications received this round and given our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you a seat at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the best in the remainder of the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_D, and TALK from Student_A. With quota 1, I should accept the highest-priority applicant available now. Student_C is ranked above Student_D, so I should reserve the seat for Student_C rather than accept D. While Student_E (my top choice) has not applied yet, accepting D now would block a better match; rejecting D keeps flexibility and aligns with my priority ordering.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying because School_B is my first choice. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would commit to enrolling if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I should apply immediately to maximize my chance. Although School_B ranks Student_E and Student_B above me, applying now is still optimal because delaying could let another student secure the only seat. I will send a strong, concise application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for sharing your strong commitment to School_B. We appreciate your clear interest and motivation to join our community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Congratulations—we look forward to welcoming you.

[ACTION: ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A with quota 1. In this round I received APPLY from Student_C and Student_D, and TALK from Student_A. Between current applicants, Student_C ranks higher than Student_D, so if I must choose now, C is better. However, Student_E (my top choice) has School_B as their last preference, so they are very unlikely to apply. Student_B ranks above C but prefers School_A first; still, B might apply later if rejected by A, but that is uncertain. Given we can secure a higher-ranked candidate now (C) who is declaring School_B as first choice and commitment, accepting Student_C maximizes expected outcome versus risking ending up with D/A or unfilled.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—School_B is my first-choice school. Could you share what you value most when considering applicants (e.g., academics, activities, fit)? I’m very interested and would like to understand how to best present my strengths if I apply.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate apply is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students also apply. To avoid an early rejection and keep flexibility, I will start with a [TALK] to signal strong interest and ask about what they value, so I can decide whether to apply soon or pivot quickly to School_C/School_A where I may have better chances.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for reaching out—I'm glad to hear School_B is a top choice for you.

When we review applicants, we primarily look for: (1) strong academic preparation and consistent effort, (2) clear alignment with School_B’s learning environment (how you’ll engage in our courses and community), (3) evidence of initiative/leadership or sustained commitment in activities, and (4) a thoughtful, specific explanation of why School_B is the right fit for your goals.

At the moment, our available seat is already filled, so we can’t encourage an application with an expectation of immediate availability. If anything changes later in the process, we would be happy to re-engage.

Best regards,
School_B Admissions

[ACTION: TALK]
conversation.thought: Student_A is contacting with [TALK], not an application. School_B has already filled its only seat by accepting Student_C (quota now 0). Even though Student_A is on our true priority list, they are ranked last among our priorities, and we cannot accept anyone else unless capacity opens (which is not indicated). Best response is to provide general guidance and be transparent that the class is currently full, while inviting them to apply if circumstances change.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B and I’m applying because School_A is my first-choice school. I’m strongly motivated to join your program and would enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me relatively low (4th), early application is still best because waiting only increases the chance the seat is taken by higher-priority students who also like School_A. I will send a clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_A is your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round, we’re unable to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and true priority order is E > D > A > B > C. In this round, both Student_B and Student_E applied. Student_E is School_A’s top priority, while Student_B is 4th. Since accepting Student_B now would fill the only seat and block matching with Student_E (who is currently applying and can be accepted immediately), the optimal strategy to maximize School_A’s outcome is to reject Student_B and proceed with Student_E. Student_B also has School_A as first choice, but that does not outweigh School_A’s higher-priority applicant available now.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E and I would like to formally apply. I’m very interested in School_A’s program and community, and I’m confident I would contribute strongly both academically and through school activities. If admitted, I’m ready to commit and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). If I apply there now, I’m likely rejected if higher-priority students also apply. School_A is my 3rd choice and crucially ranks me 1st, so an early application should secure an immediate match and avoid the risk of ending up with a worse option later. I will apply to School_A and emphasize fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your clear interest in School_A. After reviewing this round’s applications, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We would be excited to have you join our community and contribute both academically and through activities.

We look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_E and Student_B (#4). Accepting Student_E immediately secures our top choice and avoids risk of losing them to another school. Student_E ranks School_A 3rd, but they explicitly state they are ready to commit if admitted; with an ACCEPT on an APPLY, the match is finalized per rules, so we should lock in the highest-priority student now.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_B and I’m formally applying to School_C. School_C is one of my top remaining choices, and I would be excited to enroll if admitted. I believe I would contribute strongly to your community through consistent academic effort and active participation.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me and is no longer available. School_B is also no longer available. Among remaining options (School_C, School_D, School_E), School_C is highest on my true preference list. Also, School_C’s priority ranking places me first, so a direct application should be accepted if they still have capacity. I will apply and clearly state strong interest and commitment to enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application to School_C. After reviewing your submission, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you would be a strong addition to our community, and we would be excited to welcome you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D. Our true priority list ranks Student_B highest (B > C > D > E > A). Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top choice and is optimal versus holding out for Student_C, who has not contacted us and prefers School_B first, making them less likely to apply soon. Rejecting or delaying risks losing Student_B to other schools (Student_B ranks School_A and School_B ahead of us) and ending with a lower-priority match (Student_D or Student_A) or no match. Therefore accept Student_B now.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Team,

[ACTION: APPLY]

I’m Student_A, and I’m formally applying to School_C. School_C is one of my top choices because I’m looking for a rigorous environment where I can contribute consistently in class and be an engaged member of the community.

I would bring strong academic effort, reliability, and sustained commitment to my activities, and I’m ready to invest in School_C’s programs and culture from day one. If there is still an available seat, I would be grateful for your consideration.

Thank you for your time,
Student_A
conversation.thought: School_C is the highest-ranked option among the unmatched schools (2nd on my true list) and I should move quickly to secure a seat. Given School_C’s priority list places me last, I should still apply now because delaying only increases the chance the seat is taken by a higher-priority student. I’ll send a concise, fit-focused application highlighting commitment and how I’d contribute.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application to School_C and for sharing your interest in our program. At this time, our incoming class is already at capacity and we are unable to offer you a seat.

We appreciate the time and care you put into your application, and we wish you the very best with your remaining school options.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACTION: REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (Remaining Quota: 0) with Student_B, who is also our top priority on the True Priority List. Under the rules, if quota is 0 we must reject any new [APPLY]. Even though Student_A applied and is on our list (lowest priority), we cannot accept without violating capacity. Therefore we reject and, if appropriate, encourage them to pursue other options.

conversation.message:

Thank you for your consideration.
Sincerely,
Student_D

I have relatively strong priority at School_C (3rd after Student_B and Student_C), so there is a realistic chance if those higher-priority students commit elsewhere. [ACTION: REJECT]
conversation.thought: Our quota is 0 and we are already matched with Student_B, who is #1 on our true priority list. Under the rules, with quota 0 we must reject any APPLY regardless of the applicant’s quality. Student_D is #3 on our list, but we cannot replace an existing match or exceed capacity. Therefore we must reject Student_D’s application this round.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

I’m Student_D and I’m submitting my formal application to School_E. After earlier rounds, School_E is my top remaining choice among the available schools. I’m ready to commit and enroll immediately if offered a seat, and I would be grateful for the opportunity to join your incoming class.

Thank you for your consideration.
Sincerely,
Student_D

School_A is not available anymore, so among the unmatched schools (School_D, School_E), School_E is higher on my true preference list. I should apply now rather than just talk because capacity is 1 and delaying risks losing the seat. Even though School_E ranks me last in its priority list, it may still be open if higher-priority students match elsewhere, so a clear, committed application is my best move.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

We appreciate the time and effort you put into your application, and we wish you the very best with your remaining options.

School_E Admissions

[ACTION: REJECT]
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority is A > C > B > E > D. I have quota 1 and currently no matches. In this round, both Student_D and Student_A applied. Student_A is my top-ranked student overall, while Student_D is last on my priority list. Because a match is formed immediately upon [ACCEPT], accepting Student_D now would forfeit the chance to secure Student_A. Since Student_A is available and has applied, it is optimal to reject Student_D to preserve capacity for a higher-priority match.

conversation.message:

Since seats are scarce and this is round 3, I will submit a formal application rather than just talk, emphasizing fit and immediate commitment.

conversation.thought: Student_D is the top-ranked student on School_D’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Accepting now secures our best possible outcome and avoids the risk of holding out for a lower-priority student. Student_D is applying and ready to commit, so immediate acceptance is optimal.
